headline: Is Conagra Brands (CAG) Now An Opportunity After Recent Share Price Weakness
summary: If you are wondering whether Conagra Brands at US$18.51 is a potential bargain or a value trap, you are not alone. That is exactly what this article will help you unpack. The stock has returned 2.3% over the last 7 days and 7.0% over the last 30 days and year to date, although the 1 year return of a 21.8% decline and 3 year and 5 year returns of 40.8% and 32.6% declines show a mixed picture over different time frames. Recent attention on Conagra Brands has centered on how the company fits...

headline: BANQUET® MEGA™ BREAKFAST BOWLS DELIVER BIG PROTEIN FOR YOUR MORNING
summary: Conagra Brands, Inc. (NYSE: CAG), one of North America's leading branded food companies, is bringing a protein-packed new offering to breakfast with the debut of new Banquet® MEGA™ Breakfast Bowls. With 30g of protein per bowl, four new varieties offer a hearty, tasty breakfast that's built on the Banquet MEGA promise of big flavor, big protein, and big value1.

content.title: BANQUET® MEGA™ BREAKFAST BOWLS DELIVER BIG PROTEIN FOR YOUR MORNING
content.summary: Conagra Brands, Inc. (NYSE: CAG), one of North America's leading branded food companies, is bringing a protein-packed new offering to breakfast with the debut of new Banquet® MEGA™ Breakfast Bowls. With 30g of protein per bowl, four new varieties offer a hearty, tasty breakfast that's built on the Banquet MEGA promise of big flavor, big protein, and big value1.

thumbnail.caption: Conagra Brands is bringing a protein-packed new offering to breakfast with the debut of new Banquet MEGA Breakfast Bowls. With 30g of protein per bowl, four new varieties, including Meat Lovers, offer a hearty, tasty breakfast that’s built on the Banquet MEGA promise of big flavor, big protein, and big value.

headline: Could Conagra’s New MEGA Breakfast Bowls Redefine Its Frozen Aisle Strategy for CAG Investors?
summary: Conagra Brands recently expanded its frozen breakfast portfolio with Banquet MEGA Breakfast Bowls, protein-heavy meals that use tray-in-tray steaming technology and offer more food per serving than a leading rival, rolling out to grocery and mass retailers from February 2026. This product push aligns with Conagra’s broader emphasis on protein-rich, all-day breakfast and restaurant-inspired frozen offerings, aimed at capturing a larger share of a U.S. frozen food market projected to reach...
